creator: wsmwk

content: For future reference, profiles created in zip format by thunderbird do not include passwords. That is for security in case the zip file falls into unfriendly hands. If there are saved passwords, thunderbird is using them. if you are receiving error messages, it may be that the password is wrong or the settings are wrong. On your request, you can manually extract the passwords with these steps:: - setting>privacy&security - click savedpasswords and then showpasswords - copy the passwords for your backup\ - then, highlight the rows that apply to that account and delete them That clears the passwords, so when you next retrieve messages, the account should prompt for password and you can enter it.
creator: davidsk

content:
While the 1961 Ford Thunderbird is neat looking car, this is the wrong place to ask for such help.

This support forum section is for support of the Thunderbird email client https://www.thunderbird.net/

There are forums that discusses things related to the 1961 Thunderbird like for example https://vintagethunderbirdclub.net/phpBB3/viewforum.php?f=6 and https://www.tbirdforum.com/forums/bullet-birds-1961-1963.14/ though the people there may want you give more details so they can help you get the parts and or replace, fix etc.

The list of the things being supported on support.mozilla.org is at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/new as none of them are about old cars.

Just remember my family had a green seventh generation Ford Thunderbird for several years. I remember those retractable covers for the headlamps. It was a rather large car for two doors.
creator: James

content: First, Local Folders are local to the PC, and are not available on phone. You can view and respond to messages from phone, but your sent messages will remain on phone if using POP there, and not visible on PC. Likewise, you will not see messages on phone that were sent from desktop. Also, both phone and desktop will be able to view incoming messages only when the other device has not deleted them. Consider, you're reading from the same source, so if you delete from phone when downloading, it won't be visible on desktop. If you want both to be in sync, the only solution is to use IMAP for both.
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks for the reply. After reading your reply I searched the TB settings and found the option "Leave Messages on Server Until I Delete Them". At present this is unchecked and so the emails are auto deleted from the server. I would guess there is something similar on the Mobile App settings as well. Thanks again.

content: Something is interrupting thunderbird when it shuts down and updates the prefs.js file and message filter files. possibly a vpn or antivirus or firewall - I have no idea which. Others on this forum may have more specific suggestions on this. Sometimes, when the prefs.js is being saved, windows saves as prefs-1.js in lieu of the prefs.js because of the problem. If you see that in profile, that indicates this is an issue.
creator: davidsk

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next
